body: Lossy custom packets cannot be split, therefore they need to be limited to the maximum safe UDP packet size. - - - This change is [](https://reviewable.io/reviews/toktok/c-toxcore/2355)

comment_data.body: You wrote this same check 4 times, how about turning it into a function?
General question, why are lossy packets so much smaller?
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -3303,6 +3303,16 @@ uint32_t tox_group_max_part_length(void);
  */
 #define TOX_GROUP_MAX_MESSAGE_LENGTH    1368
 
+/**
+ * Maximum length of a group custom lossy packet.
+ */
+#define TOX_GROUP_MAX_CUSTOM_LOSSY_PACKET_LENGTH 500

comment_data.body: 500 is about largest size of a UDP packet that can safely traverse almost any network. See [this thread ](https://stackoverflow.com/questions/1098897/what-is-the-largest-safe-udp-packet-size-on-the-internet)for further explanation.
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -3303,6 +3303,16 @@ uint32_t tox_group_max_part_length(void);
  */
 #define TOX_GROUP_MAX_MESSAGE_LENGTH    1368
 
+/**
+ * Maximum length of a group custom lossy packet.
+ */
+#define TOX_GROUP_MAX_CUSTOM_LOSSY_PACKET_LENGTH 500

comment_data.body: Very interesting, might be worth linking that as the source for this value, because otherwise `500` is very magic.
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -3303,6 +3303,16 @@ uint32_t tox_group_max_part_length(void);
  */
 #define TOX_GROUP_MAX_MESSAGE_LENGTH    1368
 
+/**
+ * Maximum length of a group custom lossy packet.
+ */
+#define TOX_GROUP_MAX_CUSTOM_LOSSY_PACKET_LENGTH 500

comment_data.body: I still think that for LOSSY 500 is an arbitrary low limit. I am full on board for LOSSLESS however.
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -3303,6 +3303,16 @@ uint32_t tox_group_max_part_length(void);
  */
 #define TOX_GROUP_MAX_MESSAGE_LENGTH    1368
 
+/**
+ * Maximum length of a group custom lossy packet.
+ */
+#define TOX_GROUP_MAX_CUSTOM_LOSSY_PACKET_LENGTH 500

comment_data.body:
500 seems just a random number, since toaxv is using a much higer limit (about 13xx bytes) for lossy packets.
so if toxav is ok, why should groups not be?
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -3303,6 +3303,16 @@ uint32_t tox_group_max_part_length(void);
  */
 #define TOX_GROUP_MAX_MESSAGE_LENGTH    1368
 
+/**
+ * Maximum length of a group custom lossy packet.
+ */
+#define TOX_GROUP_MAX_CUSTOM_LOSSY_PACKET_LENGTH 500

comment_data.body: The number is not "random" and I have already explained why that value was chosen. I also added a link to said explanation in a comment. If older parts of toxcore are wrong, it does not logically follow that we should repeat those mistakes in new code, which is what your argument is tantamount to.
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -3303,6 +3303,16 @@ uint32_t tox_group_max_part_length(void);
  */
 #define TOX_GROUP_MAX_MESSAGE_LENGTH    1368
 
+/**
+ * Maximum length of a group custom lossy packet.
+ */
+#define TOX_GROUP_MAX_CUSTOM_LOSSY_PACKET_LENGTH 500

comment_data.body: also toxcore itsself uses UDP and packets of about 1373 bytes.
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -3303,6 +3303,16 @@ uint32_t tox_group_max_part_length(void);
  */
 #define TOX_GROUP_MAX_MESSAGE_LENGTH    1368
 
+/**
+ * Maximum length of a group custom lossy packet.
+ */
+#define TOX_GROUP_MAX_CUSTOM_LOSSY_PACKET_LENGTH 500

commit.message:
Fix group custom packet size limits

Lossy custom packets cannot be split, therefore they need to be limited
to the maximum safe UDP packet size.
